title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 18 August 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
01:50 <edvorg> has quit  
07:01 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> has quit  
09:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:00 <Inge-> has quit  
11:03 <vmassol1> good morning  
11:03 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:03 <vmassol> reminder: 8.3M1 release date is 22nd of August  
11:03 <vmassol> ie next Monday  
11:03 <vmassol> ie in 2 working days  
11:03 <vmassol> we need to start stabilizing the build/ci  
11:07 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <vmassol> hmm found some regression in the breadcrumb  
11:13 <vmassol> on master  
11:13 <vmassol> it doesn't work anymore at all for me  
11:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <vmassol> guys can someone confirm the problem?  
11:18 <vmassol> mflorea, tmortagne, Enygma`, evalica?  
11:18 <vmassol> I'm referring to clicking the arrow in a breadcrumb element  
11:18 <vmassol> it opens an empty list for me  
11:22 <evalica> vmassol: I'm on a 8.2.1 and the breadcrumb is working  
11:24 <vmassol> I'm talking about master  
11:24 <vmassol> maybe there's been a regression somewhere  
11:24 <vmassol> (I've just rebuilt enterprise master from sources)  
11:27 <vmassol> actually it's even worse  
11:27 <vmassol> the doc tree doesn't load either  
11:27 <vmassol> maybe it's my build  
11:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: I had this issue after an upgrade to 8.2 and just cleaned the browser cache  
11:32 <vmassol> cleaning the cache didn't help  
11:32 <vmassol> (I'm downloading a snapshot now)  
11:33 <vmassol> I'll try a hard cache clean first  
11:33 <vmassol> same problem after a hard cache clean  
11:49 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:50 <vmassol> ok so I've downloaded a snapshot of master  
11:50 <vmassol> and it's working  
11:50 <vmassol> so I must have something wrong in my local build somewhere  
11:50 <vmassol> pfew....  
11:52 <mflorea> I confirm it works with the latest snapshot  
11:52 <mflorea> check the JavaScript console, maybe there's some JavaScript error on your own build  
11:52 <vmassol> there are  
11:53 <vmassol> which si why it's not working ;)  
11:53 <mflorea> ok :)  
11:58 <vmassol> evalica: should I open a jira for https://www.evernote.com/l/AHf\_3\_4VbMtPx59JGCTaULQsNSy\_\_nTSR5c ?  
11:59 <vmassol> ouch another problem  
12:00 <vmassol> I'm now getting this when creating a new page under an existing one: https://www.evernote.com/l/AHes4Aile0pBi7CpkmIC3fTDYKdDsN8SQ7s  
12:00 <vmassol> ant idea?  
12:00 <vmassol> \*any  
12:00 <vmassol> check the title displayed  
12:01 <vmassol> even worse it fails when I change the title and click save  
12:01 <vmassol> with a large stack trace  
12:01 <evalica> vmassol: there is a similar issue reported http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7715  
12:01 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/8f27ed871955605d03b25c3acde88417  
12:01 <vmassol> evalica: ok I'll add my image to it then  
12:10 <vmassol> can someone confirm the problem?  
12:10 <vmassol> (creating a child page)  
12:10 <vmassol> (I've had the problem using the last master snasphot)  
12:44 <vmassol> nobody avail to test this?  
12:45 <vmassol> hmm strange  
12:46 <vmassol> now I also get the same problem as I had on my master build with the navigation panel being empty and breadcrumb arrows not working  
12:46 <vmassol> I get that too if I restart  
12:46 <vmassol> (I'm still on the last snapshot build from ci)  
12:46 <vmassol> so there's something amiss  
12:46 <vmassol> thing to try:  
12:47 <vmassol> 1) create a new page and save  
12:47 <vmassol> 2) try creating a children page of that new page  
12:50 <vmassol> btw the tour doesn't start either  
12:52 <vmassol> and create page doesn't show templates  
12:53 <mflorea> vmassol: I can reproduce the fact that the create page wizard pre-fills the title input with some strange title (it's actually the title of the HTML page) and this seems to be caused by the fact that #template('something') resets the Velocity variables..  
12:53 <mflorea> I need to go to lunch, I'll investigate more afterwards  
13:00 <vmassol> mflorea: when you create a subpage you don't get the save stack trace?  
13:00 <vmassol> ok  
13:00 <vmassol> note: you need to use the UI to get the error  
13:00 <vmassol> if you create using the URL directly it works  
13:10 <vmassol> note: no BFD today (Alex forgot ;) ). We need to fix the build anyway  
13:10 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <vmassol> and the many issues discovered  
13:10 <vmassol> for the release of Monday  
13:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:50 <mflorea> vmassol: btw, the template selection is missing  
13:51 <mflorea> I get the stacktrace and it seems to be related to the missing template selection UI  
13:53 <vmassol> mflorea:  
13:53 <vmassol> yes I noticed that too (see above)  
13:53 <vmassol> and the tour doesn't execute either  
13:53 <vmassol> so you can reproduce  
13:53 <vmassol> so we have a real issue  
14:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <mflorea> I commented on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13558 regarding the value of the title input  
14:23 <M-vmassol> has quit  
14:24 <vmassol> mflorea: ah cool you found a lead on the issue  
14:25 <vmassol> so it's indeed possible that all our various issues are coming from this issue  
14:25 <mflorea> it's only the part related to the "toto (Main.toto.WebHome) - XWiki" value in the title field  
14:26 <mflorea> I'm trying to see where the template selection UI has dissapeared  
14:26 <vmassol> k thx  
14:29 <M-vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <mflorea> vmassol: it's the same root cause, I'm updating my comment  
14:32 <vmassol> k thx  
14:32 <polx> Hello XWiki-experts, does anyone know of a button/macro/xx to download all attachments of a page (or space) as a zip file?  
14:35 <vmassol> maybe use the XFF filter: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XFF+filter  
14:35 <vmassol> hi polx  
14:35 <vmassol> not exactly what you ask but close  
14:35 <vmassol> it would export all attachments to your FS  
14:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: you're on XWIKI-13558?  
14:54 <vmassol> guillaume is the next RM for Monday btw but he's still on holidays apparently  
14:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: I will  
14:54 <vmassol> he's probably back Monday but he won't be able to prepare the stabilization so we should probably do it today and tomorrow  
14:54 <vmassol> k thx  
14:55 <vmassol> we also need to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/TOUR-43 ASAP  
14:55 <vmassol> acotiuga: maybe this is something you could do?  
14:56 <vmassol> since you worked on the tour app  
14:56 <acotiuga> Yes, I'll take it  
14:56 <vmassol> k cool :)  
14:56 <vmassol> would be great if it could be fixed today or tomorrow so that we can have the build succeed for the Monday release  
15:08 <msmeria> has quit  
15:10 <polx> thanks @vmassol. I guess I was looking for something more streamlined, especially using the tasks. I’ll try to bake that one day.  
15:30 <tmortagne> mflorea: I'm currently looking at XWIKI-13558  
15:30 <tmortagne> I know what is the issue with $template  
15:31 <tmortagne> as far as I can see it's a special Velocity binding  
15:31 <tmortagne> it's defined in all Velocity scripts  
15:32 <tmortagne> I need to add it to the list of variables to not move from VelocityContext to ScriptContext  
15:32 <tmortagne> easy fix but since it's a special binding we should probably avoid using it on our side  
15:32 <tmortagne> fixing the $template variable and I will debug the $title one  
15:35 <tmortagne> what I understand from the  code is that template is used to deal with scope in Velocity so really not something we should mess with  
15:38 <tmortagne> mflorea: you can see the current known special Velocity bindings in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/render/DefaultVelocityManager.java#L183  
15:38 <tmortagne> adding "template" in there  
15:39 <mflorea> ok  
15:48 <vmassol> tmortagne: when you have some time, maybe you have some idea to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13609 ?  
15:49 <tmortagne> looks like something special on Windows  
15:49 <vmassol> yes but from what I see it should work fine  
15:49 <vmassol> (what I see in the code)  
15:50 <tmortagne> either a bug in the JVM that was used n this case or Windows does not want to release the file (like it happen sometimes)  
15:53 <vmassol> yes the problem is that the status.xml file must be loaded when we try to replace it  
15:53 <vmassol> this works on linux but not windows  
15:53 <vmassol> \*is = is probably  
15:57 <tmortagne> this report is recent and it's working like this since a very long time so it's probably not all Windows or all JVM  
15:58 <vmassol> well it depends if some other thread has a handle on it  
15:58 <vmassol> so it could be a race condition  
15:58 <vmassol> for sure it would only happen on windows  
15:58 <vmassol> and it's a warning too  
15:58 <vmassol> so most users won't report it  
15:59 <vmassol> manuel said in the issue that he's seen this several times  
15:59 <tmortagne> most users probably but Manuel is testing on Windows  
15:59 <vmassol> it's also possible that some refzctoring we did made it happen more often recently  
16:03 <vmassol> so we're doing a BFD after all? :)  
16:06 <vmassol> btw we have a thread on the list with some directoy creation failure too  
16:06 <vmassol> Caused by: class java.lang.IllegalStateException: Failed to create directory  
16:06 <vmassol> within 10000 attempts (tried 1471421247917-0 to 1471421247917-9999)  
16:06 <vmassol> "NB Just had the same error with the distribution wizard when installing  
16:06 <vmassol> initial set of pages:"  
16:07 <vmassol> 2 users having this error apparently  
16:07 <vmassol> http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/Distribution-Wizard-td7600517.html#a7600689  
16:07 <vmassol> too bad google doesn't show the OS error  
16:08 <vmassol> probably a permission issue  
16:08 <vmassol> I'llreply  
16:27 <Inge-> has quit  
16:34 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
16:59 <polx> Hey guys, anyone knows if plain-http-auth has reasons not work on a vanilla setup?  
17:00 <polx> I tried with superadmin and a regular admin and both failed.  
17:00 <vmassol> no idea, I don't know about this  
17:00 <polx> (using plain-auth, obtaining directly a valid page when requesting: http://user:password@server/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences )  
17:00 <polx> this has been used in multiple automation scripts.  
17:01 <polx> could it be jetty-bound??  
17:01 <vmassol> ah I thought you were talkig about some header  
17:01 <vmassol> http header  
17:01 <polx> Plain-auth does use header.  
17:01 <vmassol> it should work OOB AFAIK  
17:01 <polx> the URL writing is a way to feed the headers. It doesn’t go into the URL line.  
17:02 <vmassol> nothing special mentioned here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HBasicAuthentication  
17:02 <polx> I’ve met a few times where it failed, and am now facing it again. I really can’t tell or debug why.  
17:02 <vmassol> you need ?basicauth=1  
17:02 <Inge-> has quit  
17:02 <polx> do I? trying.  
17:02 <evalica> has quit  
17:03 <vmassol> see the link I gave  
17:03 <polx> wow, indeed!  
17:04 <polx> thanks  
17:05 <vmassol> np  
17:06 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <Inge-> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <Denis> has quit  
17:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
17:39 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <Denis> has quit  
18:02 <tmortagne1> has joined #xwiki  
18:02 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:07 <tmortagne1> has quit  
18:11 <vmassol> has quit  
18:20 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
18:21 <jonesmeier> hi, just upgraded to the new version, is there an easy way to have the navigation panel show all spaces instead of just a few and the "show more" link ?  
18:29 <jonesmeier> found the 'limit' parameter for the documentTree macro thats in the panel, and added that for now  
18:29 <jonesmeier> 0/-1 doesn't disable the limit unfortunately :|  
18:42 <Denis1> has quit  
18:43 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
18:45 <mflorea> has quit  
18:45 <evalica> has quit  
18:48 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:50 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
18:52 <Denis> has quit  
18:55 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
18:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:56 <vmassol> jonesmeier: hi  
18:56 <Denis1> has quit  
18:56 <vmassol> the navigation panel has to scale, this is why it has to be liimted  
18:57 <vmassol> you can use limit = 100 if you want  
18:57 <vmassol> 100 is already pretty large in term of screen estate  
19:01 <jonesmeier> vmassol: thank you for the reply! i stuck with a limit of 100  
19:03 <Denis> has quit  
19:04 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
19:04 <jonesmeier> and yeah i see why not having any limit wouldn't make sense at some point  
19:08 <vmassol> ok cool :)  
19:08 <vmassol> there are 2 issues  
19:08 <vmassol> - screen estate  
19:08 <vmassol> - but more importantly, performances  
19:08 <vmassol> (the more items you display the slower it takes)  
19:15 <jonesmeier> yes i noticed there's a very short load to build the list, but it's all looking nice and clean now with the new nav and themes :)  
19:21 <jonesmeier> so i'm looking forward to get into the new version, thanks as always for helping out here! cheers  
19:23 <vmassol> cool  
19:23 <vmassol> let us know about how you like or not the new version  
19:23 <vmassol> and any feedback to improve things!  
19:23 <vmassol> we love to get feedback  
19:24 <vmassol> especially about what to improve  
19:24 <vmassol> (jonesmeier)  
19:24 <vmassol> a mail with some feedback on the list would be awesome  
19:24 <vmassol> :)
